page.title: 02BICKLEIGH AND TOURISM
page.content: Bickleigh, well publicised as a tourist attraction, provides, in the complex of buildings at the bridge, a photographer's delight. Guests from all over the world stay at Bickleigh Cottage Guest House. Americans favour it, but a typical June page from the visitors' book might well include entries from India, Australia, Chile, Korea and Austria. The Fisherman's Cot Hotel is much enlarged from the original cottages of the turn of the century; there are now 20 bedrooms (more planned) and 2 dining rooms. The Trout Inn, also thatched, has a con- tinuous history as a village hostelry. Bickleigh Mill is a museum, farm and craft centre, preserving traditional activities and animal breeds from loss.
